unnormalised: The IMD (India Meteorological Department) has issued an alert for heavy rainfall in Kerala from 05/07/2024 to 07/07/2024. Expect temperatures to fluctuate between 27°C and 31°C during the day. Sunset will be around 6:45 PM IST, and sunrise is predicted for 6:00 AM IST the following day.
normalised: The I-M-D (India Meteorological Department) has issued an alert for heavy rainfall in Kerala from fifth july two thousand and twenty four to seventh july two thousand and twenty four. Expect temperatures to fluctuate between twenty seven degree celsius and thirty one degree celsius during the day. Sunset will be around six forty five P-M I-S-T, and sunrise is predicted for six zero zero A-M I-S-T the following day.

unnormalised: Northern India will experience a heatwave, with temperatures soaring up to 45 deg C in Delhi and Rajasthan. The forecast for Chandigarh indicates a partly cloudy sky on 06/07/24, with a slight chance of thunderstorms around 4 PM. The humidity levels are expected to remain around 60% throughout the day.
normalised: Northern India will experience a heatwave, with temperatures soaring up to forty five degree celsius in Delhi and Rajasthan. The forecast for Chandigarh indicates a partly cloudy sky on sixth july two thousand and twenty four, with a slight chance of thunderstorms around four P-M. The humidity levels are expected to remain around sixty percent throughout the day.

unnormalised: Mumbai will have moderate rainfall with intermittent showers expected from 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM. High tide is expected at 3:15 PM at 4.2 meters. Fishermen are advised not to venture out into the sea before 08/07/2024, as sea conditions will remain rough with wind speeds reaching 50 kmph.
normalised: Mumbai will have moderate rainfall with intermittent showers expected from eleven zero zero A-M to two zero zero P-M. High tide is expected at three fifteen P-M at four point two meters. Fishermen are advised not to venture out into the sea before eighth july two thousand and twenty four, as sea conditions will remain rough with wind speeds reaching fifty kilometer per hour.
